Lack of evidence: The Biden campaign did not provide any evidence to support the claim that individuals were not allowed to own cannons during the Revolutionary War.
Dubious existence of laws: Historians of the period are skeptical that laws against private cannon ownership actually existed during the Revolutionary War.
Examples of privateers: There are documented instances of privately owned vessels, known as privateers, sailing with cannons during the Revolutionary War. This suggests that private individuals may have been allowed to own cannons.
Lack of specific law: Despite the Biden campaign's assertion, they were unable to point to a specific law that prohibited individual ownership of cannons during the Revolutionary War. Historians also express doubt that such laws were in place.
